DOC.detailed_description: Treatment acute primary HIV infection may improve long-term outcome . However , optimal treatment still debate . The main objective multicentric randomize phase II/III study compare HIV viremia 92 96 week acute primary HIV infection , patient treat 3 different strategy . In first group , patient receive antiretroviral drug ( HAART ) continuously week 72 . In second group , patient receive HAART continuously week 36 , intermittently week 72 . In third group , patient receive HAART group II , pegylated interferon alpha administer initial 14 week , 3 week 3 HAART interruption week 36 week 72 . All patient monitor without HAART week 96 . Enrolled patient circulate p24 antigen and/or HIV viremia , uncompleted HIV western blot , 18 65 year old , agree participate study . They receive antiretroviral drug , pregnant , without neuro-psychological autoimmune disorder , without chronic hepatitis . Secondary objective study : quality immune restoration , anti-HIV immune response , safety adhesion treatment . A total 90 patient ( 30 group ) enrol .
